segment.source: This section provides step-by-step instructions on implementing the Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) in typical environments.
segment.target: This section provides step-by-step instructions on implementing the Volume Activation Management Tool (VAMT) in typical environments.

segment.source: VAMT supports many common scenarios; the scenarios in this section describe some of the most common to get you started.
segment.target: VAMT supports many common scenarios; the scenarios in this section describe some of the most common to get you started.

segment.source: Describes how to distribute Multiple Activation Keys (MAKs) to products installed on one or more connected computers within a network, and how to instruct these products to contact Microsoft over the Internet for activation.
segment.target: Describes how to distribute Multiple Activation Keys (MAKs) to products installed on one or more connected computers within a network, and how to instruct these products to contact Microsoft over the Internet for activation.

segment.source: Describes how to use two VAMT host computers — the first one with Internet access and a second computer within an isolated workgroup — as proxies to perform MAK volume activation for workgroup computers that do not have Internet access.
segment.target: Describes how to use two VAMT host computers — the first one with Internet access and a second computer within an isolated workgroup — as proxies to perform MAK volume activation for workgroup computers that do not have Internet access.

segment.source: Describes how to use VAMT to configure client products for Key Management Service (KMS) activation.
segment.target: Describes how to use VAMT to configure client products for Key Management Service (KMS) activation.

segment.source: By default, volume license editions of Windows 10, Windows Vista, Windows® 7, Windows 8, Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2008 R2, or Windows Server® 2012, and Microsoft® Office 2010 use KMS for activation.
segment.target: By default, volume license editions of Windows 10, Windows Vista, Windows® 7, Windows 8, Windows Server 2008, Windows Server 2008 R2, or Windows Server® 2012, and Microsoft® Office 2010 use KMS for activation.
